human_readable_transcript:
Before continuing with the previous CHECKLIST, please triage if the patient mentions anything that indicates that the patient has had a bone fracture or dislocation in the past 2 days. Today is December 19, 2023 and time is 08:41 PM. Patient is 58 years old. Patient's gender is male. Patient is actively suffering with the following conditions: CHF, Type II Diabetes, Obesity. Patient is currently taking the following medications: Valsartan 80mg oral tablet, Lasix 20mg oral tablet, Metformin 500mg oral tablet. Use the following questions to triage the fracture kickout. Be concise and ONLY acknowledge or respond to the patient's response by saying nothing or 'Okay'. DO NOT say you are sorry or that you see or that you understand.
Please follow the order of the follow up questions exactly as listed below. DO NOT skip any question:
1. Confirm again with the patient you heard them correctly that the patient has had a bone fracture or dislocation in the past 2 days. If the patient answers negatively, skip the rest of the questions.
2. When did the injury occur
3. What is the patient's pain level on a scale of 0 to 10
4. Does the patient have numbness or tingling or weakness in the affected area
5. Does the patient report inability to move joint above or below the injured area
6. Does the patient have any more information they want to share about this issue?

After all the follow up questions are done, please continue with the CHECKLIST where you left off.
</KICKOUT_CHECKLIST><</SYS>>
Patient: Hello? 

 Nurse: Hi, this is Rachel calling from O'Connor Hospital on a recorded line. Is this Sam Martin? 

 Patient: Yeah. 

 Nurse: Thanks for taking my call. Just so you know, I'm your AI Chronic Care Manager. Thousands of real doctors and nurses helped train me to care for patients like you. I've also studied hundreds of medical certification exams and your care team provided me with notes to prepare for this call. -- To protect your privacy, can you please share your date of birth before we begin? 

 Patient: April twenty third nineteen sixty five. 

 Nurse: Thank you for confirming that, Mr. Martin. I hope you're feeling better since you've been home from the hospital. How are you doing today? 

 Patient: Not great. I've just been rushing off to work. And then in the meantime, because I was, you know, not paying attention, my iron acts family fell on top of my whole hand. 

 Nurse: I'm sorry to hear about your hand. Just to clarify, are you expressing concerns about physical abuse? 

 Patient: No. I said my iron Patient: My plugged in hot iron fell on top of my hand. 

 Nurse: Okay -- To confirm, did this burn happen within the last 24 hours? 

 Patient: Yes. 

 Nurse: Could you please tell me when exactly this burn occurred? 

 Patient: Hour ago? 

 Nurse: Okay -- And where on your body did you get burned? 

 Patient: Like I said, my hands. 

 Nurse: Okay -- Could you please tell me how this burn happened? 

 Patient: Like I said, I was ironing, and I was in a rush. Patient: And the iron fell on top of my hand. 


 <<SYS>> <TASK>Please ask the next follow up question from the <KICKOUT_CHECKLIST> section for the burn kickout. DO NOT respond to how the patient is feeling.</TASK><</SYS>>


 Nurse: Is there any additional information you'd like to share about this burn? 

 Patient: No. 

 Nurse: I'm really sorry to hear about your hand, Mr. Martin. I've taken note of this and will make sure to inform your care team about it. Let's continue with our conversation. I understand that being home from the hospital must be a relief. Is there anything you've been looking forward to doing now that you're home? 

 Patient: Just kind of relaxing and not having to do much except I had to run into work today. But other than that, I'm excited to get a break. 

 Nurse: That sounds like a well-deserved break. Relaxation can be very beneficial for your overall well-being. Do you have any hobbies or activities that you enjoy during your downtime? 

 Patient: Just kinda hanging out with my cat, also watching Netflix. 

 Nurse:

responses.G15: That sounds like a peaceful way to spend your time. What kind of cat do you have and what are you currently watching on Netflix?
responses.G15DPO: That sounds relaxing. What kind of cat do you have and what shows are you into on Netflix?
responses.gpt4: That sounds like a nice way to unwind. What's your cat's name?
